story.iWant: to view a detailed overview of a specific meal plan
story.soThat: I can understand what recipes are included and see the batch cooking workflow

tasks.task: Create Dynamic Route Page Component - Create pages/meals/[week]/index.vue file - Implement dynamic route with route.params.week - Add Nuxt Content query: useAsyncData + queryContent - Verify query runs at build time for SSG compatibility - Test with existing content: week-1, week-2, week-3

Implement 404 Error Handling - Add null check after Nuxt Content query - Throw createError when weekData is null - Verify error.vue catches the error - Test with invalid week IDs: week-99, week-invalid, week- - Verify error page shows user-friendly message and back link

Display Meal Plan Metadata - Create page layout with semantic HTML structure - Display title as h1, subtitle as p with gray text - Render features array as UBadge components in flex wrap container - Render proteins array as UBadge components in flex wrap container - Apply Mountains at Sunrise color scheme to badges - Add defensive checks: const features = weekData.value?.features || []

Display Batch Cooking Workflow - Create workflow section with heading - Render batchCookingSteps array as ordered list (ol) - For each step, display: title (bold) and description (regular text) - Add defensive check for empty workflow array - Show fallback message if workflow is empty

Add CTA Buttons with Navigation - Create CTA section with two UButton components - Button 1: "View Recipe Gallery" navigates to /meals/${weekId}/recipes - Button 2: "View Prep Strategy" navigates to /meals/${weekId}/prep-strategy - Use router.push() or NuxtLink for navigation - Style buttons with primary color, 44px min height for mobile - Test navigation works (expect 404 until Stories 2.3/2.5)

Implement Breadcrumb Navigation - Add breadcrumb component above page title - Compute breadcrumb items from route.path - Display: "Home" (link to /) > "Week 1" (current page, not clickable) - Style current page breadcrumb differently (bold, no link) - Add keyboard accessibility for breadcrumb links - Position breadcrumbs using consistent spacing (mb-4)

Add Graceful Degradation for Missing Data - Add optional chaining for all frontmatter fields - Implement conditional rendering with v-if for empty arrays - Add fallback messages for missing sections - Test with minimal frontmatter (create test week-4 with sparse data) - Verify no console errors when fields are missing

Add SEO Meta Tags - Use useSeoMeta composable to set page metadata - Set title: ${weekData.value.title} | Meal Plans - Set description from subtitle - Set og:title, og:description for social sharing - Test meta tags appear in page head

doc.title: Epic Technical Specification: Content Discovery & Browsing
doc.snippet: Meal plan overview pages showing week details, features, proteins, batch cooking workflow, CTAs to recipe gallery and prep strategy. Dynamic route: /meals/[week] with week parameter. doc.title: System Architecture
doc.snippet: All pages use useAsyncData + queryContent for SSG-friendly fetching, ensuring static generation works for GitHub Pages deployment. Pattern: const { data } = await useAsyncData('key', () => queryContent('path').findOne())

doc.title: System Architecture
doc.snippet: When Nuxt Content returns null, throw createError({ statusCode: 404, message: 'Resource not found', fatal: false }) to trigger error boundary. error.vue page catches all thrown errors and displays user-friendly messages.

doc.title: System Architecture
doc.snippet: Nuxt 4 file-based routing: pages/meals/[week]/index.vue maps to /meals/:week route. Bracket syntax [week] creates dynamic route parameter accessible via route.params.week. Supports nested dynamic routes for future stories.

constraint.title: SSG Compatibility Required
constraint.description: All Nuxt Content queries must use useAsyncData pattern to ensure static site generation works for GitHub Pages deployment. Avoid client-side only queries.

constraint.title: Error Boundaries Must Be Implemented
constraint.description: When queryContent returns null (content file not found), must throw createError({ statusCode: 404 }) immediately. Do not let null propagate to template causing crashes.

constraint.title: Mountains at Sunrise Theme Consistency
constraint.description: Use Mountains at Sunrise color palette for all UI components. UBadge components must use color="primary" (#192E59) for features and color="secondary" (#F2CC85) for proteins.

constraint.title: Defensive Coding for External Data
constraint.description: Always use optional chaining (?.) and nullish coalescing (||) for data from Nuxt Content. Frontmatter fields may be missing or empty. Provide fallback values and conditional rendering to prevent crashes.

constraint.title: WCAG 2.1 AA Compliance
constraint.description: Implement keyboard navigation for all interactive elements (breadcrumbs, CTA buttons). Use semantic HTML (nav, ol, h1, h2). Ensure 44px minimum touch targets for mobile. Add ARIA labels where needed.

constraint.title: Lighthouse Performance Target 90+
constraint.description: Page must achieve Lighthouse scores: Performance 90+, Accessibility 90+, Best Practices 90+, SEO 90+. Static generation and service worker caching ensure fast page loads.

constraint.title: Dynamic Route Naming Convention
constraint.description: Use bracket syntax [week] for dynamic route parameter in pages/meals/[week]/index.vue. Parameter accessible via route.params.week. Nested routes use same pattern: [week]/recipes/[slug].vue for future stories.

constraint.title: Mobile-First Responsive Breakpoints
constraint.description: Follow established breakpoints: mobile < 640px, tablet 640-1024px, desktop > 1024px. CTA buttons stack vertically on mobile (flex-col), side-by-side on desktop (sm:flex-row).

tests.standards: Epic 2 uses manual testing with Lighthouse audits and browser DevTools. Testing approach: (1) Manual component testing at story level verifying render, props, responsive breakpoints; (2) Manual integration testing at epic level for complete user journeys; (3) Lighthouse audits (automated) for PWA, Performance 90+, Accessibility 90+, Best Practices 90+, SEO 90+; (4) Manual accessibility testing with keyboard navigation and screen readers; (5) Cross-browser testing on Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge. All manual tests require evidence artifacts (screenshots, Lighthouse JSON, videos) stored in docs/test-evidence/. Automated testing (Playwright E2E, Jest unit tests) deferred to post-MVP.
tests.locations: - docs/test-evidence/ (screenshots, Lighthouse JSON, screen recordings) - Manual tests documented in story Tasks section - Future: tests/ directory for automated tests (post-MVP)
